message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CY

This paper belongs to the field of natural language processing (NLP) and corpus linguistics, which are covered by several arXiv CS sub-categories. The paper focuses on the usage of English acronyms in Chinese texts, which involves language translation and information retrieval. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which covers NLP and related topics. The paper also uses statistical models to analyze the factors that influence language users' choice between English and Chinese forms, which falls under the sub-categories of cs.IR (Information Retrieval) and cs.LG (Machine Learning). Additionally, the paper may be relevant to the sub-categories of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.CY (Computers and Society), as it touches on the intersection of language, culture, and technology in a global context.
